availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Harrison W. Waggener (Morganfield, Kentucky, saddler and county clerk)

body.p: Morganfield, Kentucky, saddler and county clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Catherine Graham Waggener in Union County on October 24, 1839. Father of S.E.R. Waggener, John M. Waggener, Ann E. Waggener, and L.C Waggener. Married to Parmelia M. Davis Waggener. Father of P. Waggener, Emma Waggener, Joshua B. Waggener, Harry W. Waggener, and Sallie Waggener. Saddler in Union County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Saddler in Union County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Clerk of the Union County Court in 1865.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film 000562196.
